column4: Yes, I'm typing this. I did not know there was another way. I'm working with a wire-connected Windows Vista PC and a Gateway Ubuntu computer whose wireless is not working.
My best bet is Ethernet Controller or Network Controller. Do these sound right?
No, I haven't. Would you like me to do this and reconnect? IÂ´m just trying to avoid losing my help team here in the chat.
Whatcha think, Flannel?
I think I could plug it into my Ubuntu modem, see if the Internet works, and continue the chat from there.
Okay, let me look.
Thanks again, Flannel. Okay, lots of information here to sort through...
I see things that say Host Controllor or Hub but nothing that specifically rings a bell, "Wifi" in my head.
I'm trying.
Okay, let me see what I can find.
use pastebin to paste the output so we can have a look

- I'm typing on a Windows PC. I will have to lose this connection to connect it to my Ubuntu laptop, but I am willing to do it if you both approve. It may just take a minute for me to get back, and I'm afraid I'll lose you guys in the process. (And have to start all over.) Should I disconnect and then paste?
no it's ok you found you wifi card
sudo ifconfig wlan0 up
interesting! "No such device."!
what output do you get with "sudo ifconfig" ?
it's automatic because we put your nick in it
I'm not moving
I'm in France so here it's early (7 AM)

I suspected you might be European. I miss Europe so badly. (I want to move back ASAP.) I lived in Germany for a year; can understand French. I'm also Lithuanian-American but in terms of paperwork, that's a nightmare.
Merci beaucoup. Je reviens.
de rien :)
